I'LL GET US SOME MORE CRYPTO. THEN
THINK. I'VE GOT A TON OF TRAVELER'S
HOW MUCH MONEY DO YOU HAVE ON YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ad has been playing on a 13-inch TV in a small, wood- paneled office. A handful of EMPLOYEES and FAMILY MEMBERS applaud wildly. The proud owner of Northlands, BILL KROGS 60, embraces the man of the hour, Roger Lemke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-lee Christmas, knocked her outta the park, Roger! Out of the G-D park, you sonofagun! 2. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I'm just a pretty face, Bill. That copy was all you. Do got one little gripe though, boss-- if you'd waited until after Cedar Rapids we could've said winner of the Two Diamonds four years running!

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD ROGER LEMKE
dialogues.text: Aroo-aroo! Two Diamonds! Two Diamonds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men roughhouse playfully. Roger's comely wife, GWEN, holding their milk-fed TWIN TODDLERS, gives Roger a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So proud of you, Roggie. God, you rock. Doesn't your dad rock, boys?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an Elvis impersonation) Thank you. Thank you very much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughter and backslapping. After a bit, an as yet un MAN hesitantly approaches. He gently touches Roger's arm, wanting to interrupt the revelry. Roger turns.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER LEMKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tim! Timmy Lippe! Didn't even know you were here. You see it, bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnest, deeply admiring) Oh, heck yeah. You were awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite appearances to the contrary, this is our hero: TI LIPPE (pronounced Lippy), 34, wholesome and positive, tho undercurrents of desperation lurk just behind his kind ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just super... super awesome. Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what Tim, I want people to see the insurance game for what it really is-- it's a noble field. I believe that. Like I say, we're not just insuring vehicles and homes and that. Hell no. We're insuring people's dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. I say that, too... sometimes. 3. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well shit, you do, don't you? By god, I stole your line! Knew I'd heard that somewhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no biggie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bummer they cut your little deal outta the ad, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach. Y'know. Got left on the ol'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE CO-WORKER interrupts, accosts Roger and ignores

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger! Look out Brad Pitt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ol' cutting room floor, right? (upon being ignored) Brad Pitt. Ha. That's... (then, with forced nonchalance) Whoa. Cake. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim goes to the cake table. He smiles at the cake, impres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The icing on the cake, a frosted visage of Roger Lemke, smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beige Buick Skylark splashes through a puddle of snow m in the glum, isolated hamlet of Brown Valley, WI (pop: 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim bops his head and sings along as a Parliament song pl on a Good Times, Great Oldies radio station. A dour OLD L shoveling her driveway stares as he passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skylark pulls into the driveway of a tidy umber-color rambler with a nature scene painted on the garage door. 4. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flowered wallpaper. Vinyl flooring. A spoon collection. T room looks like someone's grandmother designed it. Tim en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the fridge, grabs an A & W Root Beer. He ope cupboard, removes a box of Hostess Cupcakes. He sits at t Formica kitchen table, meticulously eats the cupcake, sip soda pop and stares out the window at a bird feeder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's bedroom looks like that of a fastidious teenager. T bed. Orderly desk. Milwaukee Brewers poster (circa 1987).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim removes his penny loafers, pleated khakis and Northla Insurance polo shirt. He puts on a different pair of plea khakis, a maroon turtleneck and some Top-siders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim enters another bedroom. This one has a four-poster be clearly a parents room, clearly unused. He opens the clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A label reads GIFT CLOSET!!! Each shelf is neatly organiz Toys, knickknacks, occasion-specific greeting cards. He selects a Get Well card and a Beanie Baby duck, Quackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doorbell RINGS. Tim hurriedly signs the card. He licks envelope as he hustles to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim opens the door to MILLIE VANDERHEI, 54, a thick, depressive woman dressed like a 7th grade science teacher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is! How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's no big whoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pulls the card and Beanie Baby duck from behind his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta-da. (re. the stuffed duck) Quack, quack. D'you already have this guy? Wasn't sure. 5. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gayle SyrstГ¤d gave me a Quackers for Secret Santa last year. I can probably trade with Nan, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie sits on Tim's paisley sofa. She opens the card. On front: a Rottweiler in a nurse's outfit. Inside: "Get Wel You Deal with Me!" Then in Tim's writing, "Love, Tim."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles at the card) Cute. Brandy would never sit still long enough for me to dress her up like that. Tell you that right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to do this whole rigmarole, Tim. I told you it's just a little diarrhea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But for you to miss a day of school, Millie... I can't remember you ever calling in sick when I had you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I wasn't going through menopause when you were in middle school now was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Not to my knowledge. Not to my knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods somberly. They sit there silently for a bit. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Does your tummy feel good enough to...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie rides Tim. Tim palms her breasts. He still has on maroon turtleneck. And one brown sock. Their bodies make sound like two soft, thick hands apathetically applauding Clap-pfft, clop-pfft, clap-ffft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twin bed squeaks disapprovingly. 6. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try and... hold it, Mil. Can you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it home. Bring it home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waggles her hips with a bit more gusto. He grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bringing it. Bringing it! Bringing it! D'aaaarrgho'awesome...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim exhales. Millie exhales. That worked out well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie and Tim watch American Idol. A WOMAN sings Queen's YOU'RE MY BEST FRIEND. Tim harmonizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, you make me live! You're my best friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Tim, I can't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. But you are, babygirl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tss. Goofball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends. They sit quietly for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know Galen and Dar Krause just did a cruise to the Bahamas? Pretty reasonable they said, price-wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mediocre Jamaican accent) Ya mon, Bahama-mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little different I suppose-- a cruise. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Millie removes a cruise brochure from her pu 7. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not gonna shilly-shally around here, Tim. I found a river cruise through Germany-- Viking Line, real grade-A. It's what I want. For the honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait... Where's this coming from? We agreed on Wisconsin Dells for the honeymoon. It's what we agreed on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been to the Dells two dozen times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Roger and Gwen Lemke go to the Dells every year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they have children. Water parks are for children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Tommy Bartlett's Ski, Sky and Stage Show? It's not just a water park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy, settle. You've never even left the state of Wisconsin. Barely left Brown Valley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so great about...? You're not... You're missing the... We agreed on the Dells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He avoids eye contact. Millie takes Tim's chin in her han forcing him to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God rest her. Your mom was my best friend. But it's going on 20 years now. You gotta grow up. You gotta let go. You gotta live a life here. See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm living a perfectly fine life. I don't know why you'd want to...
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rock the waters or whatever. Ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks away again, pouting. Millie gives him a motherl hug. Over her shoulder, Tim watches a TEENAGER belting ou QUE SERA, SERA on American Idol. Then, almost inaudibly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We agreed on the Dells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN BLACK, a phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sleeps alone in his twin bed. The phone rings again. wakes with a start. He flips on the lamp, picks up the ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Oh, hey Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of profound anguish appears on Tim's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw jeez. Oh my gosh. No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a church organ playing ON EAGLES WINGS fades

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In back of a packed church, Millie whispers with WADE BRO 60, a bald, bullet-shaped man. The conversation is discre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy had it all. Everything you'd ever want. Y'know he flew a Cessna? In his spare time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always say people like that-- who live fast? They die hard. Look at River Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you'd ever want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't know. To do those things to yourself. Just perverted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ever heard of such a thing? 9. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Lemke looks peaceful in death, although it's hard t miss the marks on his neck left behind by the belt. Tim i the front of a long line of uneasy MOURNERS. Tim holds ba tears as he gently touches the marks on Lemke's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim steps aside to greet the widow Gwen Lemke in a receiv line. The grief has left her gaunt. She appears medicated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... Gwen, I'm so sorry. Roger is-- was-- is-- a personal hero to me. He just... he had it all. If there's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is interrupted by Bill Krogstad's sobs. Tim reaches ou put a comforting hand on Gwen's shoulder, but somehow end touching her breast instead. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim nods sadly as he removes his hand. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drab office is brightened with week-old funeral flowe and flaccid mylar sympathy balloons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits across from a young couple, KURT & PAM GAMBS in a small, glassed-in conference room. The couple is ten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't get it, Kurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw Christ, Pammy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on guys, how's this sound-- you can both be right. (pause for effect) I know you're probably thinking, "Oh, an umbrella policy's only for rich people." You know what I say to that? Bull roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gambskys smile, comforted. Tim is good at his job. 10. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam, Kurt-- I've known you guys since you were little kids. So let's don't think of me as an "insurance salesman." Think of me as your friend who just wants to help you protect your dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim glances up and sees Bill Krogstad staring longingly a Northlands' three TWO DIAMOND Award plaques. A beat, then Krogstad SLAMS HIS FIST THROUGH THE WOOD PANELED WALL! Th couple reels around upon hearing the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... Excuse me a sec...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim exits the conference room and approaches Krogstad, wh hand is now bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you-- can I get you a napkin or something, Bill? For that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know how Roger used to get down there to Cedar Rapids? To the ASMI Convention? Any idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. I'm with Kurt and Pam Gambsky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flew himself. In a Cessna. Pilot. (a mournful beat) It was all worked out. I was going to ease into retirement in July while Roger transitioned into his ownership role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Roger was going to buy Northlands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All worked out. Shit, Dione already put the down payment on a time share. Branson, Black Hills. Florida. Units all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cow. 11. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whole deal. Now? Now I got my back up against Christ-knows-what. No Lemke, no buyer, the wife's spending like we won the goddamn Powerball. And what's worse, because of the way, y'know, the way Roger passed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad chokes up. His grief is very real. So is Tim's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... belt and the lederhosen...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a nod, a sigh) Quote-unquote perverted, they're saying. Like Northlands has some kind of stain. Oh, I'm so goddamned tired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there...? Can I do anything to help, or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad hands Tim a Manila folder (bloodying it in the process). Tim gestures for his customers to hold tight. T opens the folder, reading aloud from a cover page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Innovations in Hog Farm Risk Mitigation." Roger's Two Diamond presentation for the ASMI Convention. I helped prepare it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need those Two Diamonds more than ever, Tim. If I'm going to sell this company, we need people to feel OK about the Northlands brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting it) Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go myself but my daughter Kayla, the heavy one? She unearthed some Polack to marry her. I'm locked into that wedding over in Gladstone. No flex. Locked in. 12. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa-whoa-wait. What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking you to fill Roger Lemke's shoes. Not gonna happen. I'm asking you to deliver his presentation-- to bring me home those Two Diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go to ASMI. To Iowa. To Cedar Rapids, Iowa... Why can't Lila do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Tim. Lila's about as charismatic as a bag of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I've never... I mean, I've dabbled in hog farm risk mitigation, but I'm no pro...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim is really starting to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were what, 16, when I gave you that filing job? Right after your mom passed? Raising yourself pretty much, living all alone. And I'm thinking, now here's a kid. Here's a kid who's gonna go places. (a hand on Tim's shoulder) And then, somehow, you kind of just didn't. Now, I guess it makes some sense-- a child loses both parents at an early age, becomes what you might call stunted. But cripes almighty, do you want to just sit there in your folks old house, just rot away in Brown Valley dating that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... woman the rest of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie and I are getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tss, maybe three'll be a charm. (then, emotional)
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Point is, I'm not exactly dancing in the streets here Tim, but it's a perception thing. You go down there to Cedar Rapids, wholesome and pie- eyed and all that. You show them that Northlands is a good outfit-- an upstanding Christian outfit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim considers the gravity of this moment.

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aw cripes, say you'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad starts crying again. He hugs Tim, his bloody han staining Tim's canary yellow V-neck sweater. Tim looks up see the Gambskys in the conference room staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A melancholic yet uplifting song (Leonard Cohen's HALLELU perhaps) plays as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Tim puts birdseed in his backyard feeder. He looks at t barren trees as he considers his fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Tim Googles "Cedar Rapids." He looks at photos, crime statistics, a Chamber of Commerce Youtube video. He close his eyes, exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Tim practices the presentation in front of a mirror. He works late. He types. He Power Points. Krogstad critiques

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Tim laminates maps of Cedar Rapids and area attractions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Tim pulls a dusty American Tourister suitcase from the attic. It looks about 40 years old. He packs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks pensive as he drives. He's wearing a new suit. a little too big. A greeting card and a Beanie Baby Roost bounce along on the passenger's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pulls up to a SPLIT-LEVEL HOUSE. A pick-up truck with words Brodt Heating & Cooling is parked in the drivew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pokes his head into a living room, surprised to see W the 60-ish bald guy from church, reclining on a Lazy Boy. 14. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade's boots are off. His socks are dirty. He's watching on a TV with an Olan-Mills portrait of Tim & Millie a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hiya Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Wade. Hey. Is Millie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie enters in a terry cloth robe. A Yorkshire Terrier follows her. Millie acts nonchalant. So does the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Tim. (re. Wade's presence) Wade's cable's down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's six AM...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike & Mike in the Morning. ESPN 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Those guys. Hilarious. Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally, to Millie) Well I just wanted to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He displays the Beanie Baby and the card. She takes them a cold smile. Tim notices an identical stuffed rooster on oak bookshelf-- home to over 155 other Beanie Babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shoot. You already have a Strut the Rooster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's jetting off to Cedar Rapids this morning, Wade. Big deal insurance convention. Iowa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only four days. 15. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't go to Germany for our honeymoon, but for work you can just gallivant around like Tom Petty or one of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We agreed on the Dells... (then, to Millie) Should we maybe talk in the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it don't bother me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim tries to proceed as if Wade weren't sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't try to do this, it's not just my job, Mil. There are four other employees whose lives are on the line. Plus Carol, who does part time seasonal work. So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for certain a new owner would even keep you guys on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bill said he'd make that part of any deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe you me, Bill Krogstad is looking out for one guy. And that's Bill Krogstad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shoots Wade a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... Oh, who am I kidding, I'm a little scared here. A lot scared. But not about us. What we've got-- we're like lightning in a bottle, babygirl. I love you so much, Mil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her. Millie melts just a little, yet remains ster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be very careful. 16. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I will. I mean, Cedar Rapids-- there were only four homicides last year. For a city of 122-thousand that's pretty darn good. The forcible rape numbers are admittedly a bit higher, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fidgets with his tie. A bitter tear skulks down her c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to check in with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will every day. Twice a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, three times! Sheesh. And I'll send a stinkin' telegram, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim kisses the warm tears from Millie's ruddy cheeks. Mil licks her finger and smooths Tim's cowlick. Wade just sit there watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim walks up to the tiny municipal airport. He tries the door. It's locked. A RETARDED MAN shoveling snow spots Ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airport don't open for two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks! Just wanna be sure I make my flight. Going down to Cedar Rapids. The big ASMI Convention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The retarded man nods vacantly and goes back to shoveling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim is the first (and only) person in the security line. apathetic TSA AGENT awaits him. Tim has a nervous energy. 17. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold enough for you? I'm heading to Cedar Rapids. Supposed to be up in the mid-30s down there. S-weet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any liquids, gels or aerosols must be placed in a quart-size Zip-Lock. Laptop computers must be taken out of the case and placed in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... what's all this now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any liquids, gels or aerosols...

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Tim! Praise Christ you haven't left yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Krogstad runs up to Tim. He's out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bill, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe I forgot to get this to you. Hang on, lemme...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad puts his hands on his knees, takes a few deep breaths. Then he hands Tim a detailed handwritten checkli

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's basically an ASMI Convention Bible. It's going to tell you who to talk to, who to avoid, how best to fellowship and network...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim glances at the list, reads the only name under AVOID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean Ziegler, Stevens Point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ziegler is a cancer. Sonofabitch called one of Lemke's biggest clients-- Joyce ArmbrГјster? Smeared Roger's name and the Northlands' name. Frickin' poacher. Avoid Ziegler like the plague. The fella I got you rooming with, Ronald Wilkes-- that's who you stick by. 18. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Ziegler's name, Tim frantically writes, "Poacher" and "ArmbrГјster--" making sure not to forget the umlaut.

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got the presentation, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim untucks his shirt, revealing a zippered cummerbund-li money belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On me at all times. Plus three back- up discs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-hey! That kind of prep is pure Lemke! Didn't know any better, I'd say Roger's spirit had kind of climbed into you, just planted its seed inside you there. Atta boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High praise indeed. Tim hesitates. Is now the right time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill... I have to ask. Let's say one of these big dogs-- your Allstates, your Prudentials-- does decide to go and buy Northlands...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said it before, I'll say it again: Your job, the office in Brown Valley-- all safe. What you need to worry about is getting down there and representing us the best you can. That's all you need to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim swallows hard. Bill brings it in for a hug and inhale Tim's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim has a window seat. He reads the safety card. He's swe anxious. A vaguely swarthy MAN (Indian? Italian? Hard to tell.), 40s, sits next to him. A perky FLIGHT ATTENDANT approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lucky ducks are obviously seated in an exit row. Score!
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just gotta make sure you're willing and able to assist crew members in the event of an emergency evacuation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man smiles nonchalantly. Tim tries to play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking what, water landing? (looks around, whispers) Terror type deal? Terrorists...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really just a formality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, I have actually never been on an airplane before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well you'll do awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a moment) OK. If you need any help, I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight attendant smiles politely, if confusedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks out the window, watching nervously as the dairy farms and frozen lakes of northern Wisconsin recede. He instinctively turns to his neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. David Marinakis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to meet you, Dave. Wondering, what kind of name is Marinakis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greek. It's Greek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marinakis. OK. Mine's German. Lippe.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in, "Don't you get lippy with me, mister." My grandma used to say that. Before she passed. Lot of people pronounce it lip. Course the high German's probably more like lipp-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Marinakis nods, goes back to his book, seemingly shutting down the conversation. Tim settles in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim hesitates before stepping onto the jetway-- one small step for man-- and just like that, he's in IOWA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim helps David Marinakis take his bag off the carousel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I say, Dave, it's not life insurance so much as it is dream insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good way of looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim hands David his card, who takes it with a genuine smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know how things go with your Alltel deal, Dave. E-mail me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do, Tim. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David exits. Tim stands there waving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim emerges from an elevator on the roof of a parking gar He inhales the chilly Iowa air. He glances at his rental agreement and spots his car, a red Chevy Cobalt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Score!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he approaches the car, he stops. He chuckles, in awe. 21. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap. Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the Cedar Rapids skyline looms-- its tal building, the Alliant Tower stretching 21 stories into th cloudy sky. Tim snaps a photo with his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Holidome sign reads, Welcome ASMI `09 Participants!!! gets out of the rental car. He looks around-- not too sha But upon spotting a SIKH CABBIE in a turban, Tim straight up and cautiously adjusts his money cummerbund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks toward the entrance, a pretty but gaunt young woman in a short denim skirt, BREE, 22, approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, can I bum a heater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm like, "this gal wants to borrow my heater?" Tss. But no, sorry, can't help you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You here for the convention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Tim Lippe. Northlands Insurance. How `bout yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Bree. I'm Bree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Bree, it's nice to meet you. But let me give you a trade secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep smoking and your premiums will go through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Mr. Surgeon General. (they laugh, then)
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to party, Tim, let me know. I'll be around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Party hearty. Nice chatting with you, Bree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are so friendly. Tim enters the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim walks in. He strolls atop the velvety green carpet, p a fountain, beneath a golden-colored chandelier and makes way to the front desk-- blown away. An apple-cheeked cler whose name tag reads TRENT, greets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking in with us, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me. Never done the hotel deal before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, welcome. I'll just need to see a credit card for the incidentals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads the name tag) Trent, I was given the impression that you honored traveler's checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we just need an imprint of your card. For the incidentals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveler's check is a fully insured method of, y'know. 100 percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm aware of that, sir. We won't charge the card unless you rent a movie or take something from the mini-bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a non-drinker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's standard, sir. 23. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim eyes Trent cautiously as he unzips his cummerbund/mon belt. He removes a credit card and reluctantly hands it o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cell phone to his ear, Tim struggles with his bag as he w to his room.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Have you seen the pool yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, but I can smell it. The chlorine. It's a super top-notch place, Mil. You'd be blown away. Oop, 321. I'm at mi casa. Just a... lemme see how this deal works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He examines the card key. He slides it in. It doesn't wor Tries again. Doesn't work. Each time he fails, it beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Key's like a stinkin' credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the door opens. And standing before Tim is a BL MAN. Tim gasps, drops his suitcase, backs away.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: What? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the man) Oh jeez. I'm sorry. I'm... Please. (turns, whispers into phone) There's an Afro-American gentleman in this room.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Well get the heck outta there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim turns back and smiles, frightened. The man looks conf

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Tim! Run like hell, Tim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Tim? Tim Lippe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim just smiles a wide, deer-in-headlights smile.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Ronald Wilkes. Bill Krogstad said we were gonna be roommates? 24. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RONALD WILKES, 45, is conservative in dress and demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Tim! Tim! Tiiim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me call you back, Mil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim clicks off his phone, just stares at Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Tim...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. Yeah. Yes. You bet. For a minute there I was like, whoa, I'm gonna be robbed here, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim laughs loudly. Ronald just looks at Tim. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's super... just super great to meet you, Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shakes Ronald's hand, holds onto it for at least two seconds too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You want to check out the room then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald leads Tim into the room, a junior suite with two b a kitchenette and a couch in the separate living room are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out these digs. Huzzah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you could do a lot worse. (a serious beat) Look Tim, I gotta put the cards on the table here. The reason we got the junior suite upgrade is because the hotel overbooked-- wedding or some such. Point being, they were asking folks to take on a third roommate to consolidate space. Now to me, being an independent owner, the savings of adding a third guy sounded like a real positive.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you've got any qualms, I hear you L & C, that's Loud & Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald has undoubtedly been called a nerd more than once. Tim, however, he is the embodiment of cool and hilarity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm down. Down with that. Heck yeah. Any idea who we're gonna be chilling with, roommate-wise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just hope he doesn't snore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine? Or someone who has terrible gas?! Like, pull my finger. Brrump! Hello, no thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim is giddy like a kid away at camp for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't Woodstock, Tim. It's a regional insurance convention. Whoever it is, I'm sure he'll be a straight shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of massive, scuffed wing-tips walk determinedly do the hall. We don't see the man they belong to, but we mos definitely hear him as he passes various CONVENTION GOERS

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Taco Bill, am I gonna see you at Horizons tonight? I hear they got their all-you-care-to-eat pussy buffet going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A booming laugh follows as the feet continue down the hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim admires Ronald's laptop. The screen saver is a photo billboard advertising Ronald Wilkes Insurance. A picture stoic-looking Ronald is the centerpiece of the billboard along with the slogan, Your Insurance Professional. 26. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far it's just the one billboard north of St. Cloud. Course the traffic load would get me more eyeballs in the Twin Cities corridor, but at the end of the day, it's N-T- S. Not Too Shabby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. N-T-S. That's hilarious. I'd love to own my own agency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open. We boom up from the scuffed wing-ti to reveal DEAN ZIEGLER, 45, whose massive personality jus barely hides an undercurrent of sadness and insecurity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baroo-baroo, let's get this party started you mother-rubbers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald deflates upon seeing Dean. He clearly knows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald Wilkes! No fucking way! The Ronimal! Gimme some love-uh, my soul broth-uh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean gives Ronald a bear hug, lifts him off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn down the volume, Ziegler. You just got here, for Pete's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks like someone deciding which direction to run fr an oncoming tornado. Dean notices Tim's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, friend, never seen a chocolate-vanilla love sandwich?! Wait until later when we get to the buttfucking! Nah, I'm having fun. Dean Ziegler. Stevens Point, Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim discreetly looks at the checklist Krogstad gave him. Under AVOID, it says DEAN ZIEGLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I won't bite. I'm medicated. Not really. But I should be. Right Ronimal? So what's your handle pal? 27. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drew the short straw with this pitiful reprobate, Tim. Dean, this is Tim Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Deanzie. Where you hail from, Tim Lippe? Quiet-land?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I do not. I'm down from Brown Valley, Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northlands Insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Krogstad's outfit. The Krogger! (beat, dials it way down) Aw shit. I was sorry as hell to hear about Lemke's passing up there. That guy was tits as a rep. Course he thought I was a big, loud asshole-- s'pose he wasn't too far off there. No boy, a real tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks. Thank you. It's... Roger was just a super great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. He'll be in my prayers. His family, too. Tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three nod. A moment of solemn silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I don't know about you wingnuts, but the Deanzie could use a drinkzie. What say we blow off the welcome hoo-ha and hit Horizons for happy hour. Two-for-one cocktails, 10 cent wings, and an all-you-care-to-eat pussy buffet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That line was unappealing last year, Dean. It remains so now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm planning to watch President Helgesson's opening remarks. 28. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't get me started on that smug fuck. Orin Helgesson is a-- pardon my French-- a cunt. Just a steaming wet dog cunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim stands there slack-jawed-- this man is evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's buying the potty-mouth nonsense you're selling, Dean. Tim, you'll learn to ignore this degenerate before too long. Let's go hear what Orin has to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Have fun ladies... Not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Ronald exit. Dean can't handle the momentary sile As he lugs his suitcase into the bedroom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party time. Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORIN HELGESSON, 69, a gentle, avuncular man with a Mr. Ro persona, addresses a crowd. A banner reading ASMI `09: Le Build a Bridge to the 22nd Century! hangs above the podiu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Orin Helgesson, your ASMI Midwest Region Chapter President. But I'm not going to make you play Hail to the Chief. Not yet anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polite laughter from the 60 or so mostly male INSURANCE WORKERS congregated in the Sunset Terrace Ballroom, which neither a terrace nor a window through which to view a su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, we've got a great line- up for ASMI `09, with our forward- looking theme, Let's Build a Bridge to the 22nd Century! Just so many innovations-- our newsletter, The ASMI-teer is now fully digital. So a lot of our breakout sessions will be dealing with this kind of "E- Commerce" sort of thing. (pause for polite applause)
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you didn't pick up your Welcome Kits, be sure and see Mike Pyle, the gentleman in the-- what color's that sweater vest Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE PYLE, 35, a round, milky-skinned man who favors swea vests, raises his hand. He's seated near Tim and Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beige.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the beige sweater vest. Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin continues O.S. but we stay with Tim and Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about this Deanzie guy. Bill Krogstad told me specifically to stay the heck away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Dean ran for President against Orin last year-- only got four votes. He's running again this year. He's just full of bluster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks deeply concerned. Back on Orin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The Two Diamonds are given every year to the agency that best exemplifies the ASMI decree: "To provide high quality insurance services and related products while maintaining Commitment to Community, Country and God." We have a record number of entries this year-- over 15 agencies competing. Good luck to you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim eyes go wide-- Did he say over 15 agencies?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say over 15 agencies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's gonna be brutal this year. I brought my A-game though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're competing? 30. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heck yeah. It's the first year I've ever had a real shot. But the guy you really have to worry about is Mike Pyle. He owns the sixth largest Allstate agency in the Upper Midwest. The guy's a shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks at Mike Pyle, the bland-looking man in the swea vest. Tim's confidence is waning. Back on Orin:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... moment of silence for the man many considered to be the Michael Jordan of Mutual Insurance Agents. Roger Lemke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin places a 4 x 6 foot poster of Roger Lemke on an ease period of mournful reflection follows. Until Orin breaks in song-- WERE YOU THERE?, a somber hymn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you there when they crucified my Lord? Were you there when they crucified my Lord?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks around nervously as the entire room joins in so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim paces, cell phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you, Mil. I'm in over my head here. I feel like I can't even swim. It was fun at first, but now it's like, I dunno. I need you so bad, babygirl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's voice picks up on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Millie's in the john.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's...? Wade?

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You bet. 31. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are...? You're at Millie's still?

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Badger hockey's on. My cable's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want her to give you a ring when she's off the john?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. Yes, please. And just, would you tell her I love her very much.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You got it, bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shuts his eyes for a moment-- be strong. Be strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, in shorts, tube socks and a very old Milwaukee Bucks tank top, reads the diagram for the chest press machine. gives it a try, lifting about 50 pounds. The only other person in the room is a WOMAN, 37, on a treadmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim glances her way, and by chance they make eye contact the mirror. She smirks. He immediately looks at the floor stay on Tim, lifting weights, eyes to the ground. But we the treadmill stop. Finally, Tim looks up to find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were checking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortified, Tim drops the weights. They crash to their bas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to tell the hotel there's a pervo in the fitness center hitting on innocent women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... Ma'am, no. I'm sorry if you... I wouldn't... I have a fiancГ©!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. That poor woman should know what you're up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, please. I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman can't keep it in. She starts laughing. 32. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry. I'm totally messing with you. God, I'm a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. OK. That was different. Ha. Yes. Yes you are. A real... jerkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Joan Ostrowski-Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOAN OSTROWSKI-FOX, middle-management sexy, if slightly t tan, puts out her hand. Tim shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get lippy with me, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Tim is taken aback by this. Joan notices Tim's outf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you play professional basketball, Tim? Because that's a pretty updated uniform there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't. I'm actually in town for the ASMI convention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that where a bunch of guys sit around a table looking up the word "gullible" in a dictionary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's an association of insur... Oh. You're screwing with me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed I am. I'm here for ASMI, too. In from Oh-my-god, Nebraska. Just kidding-- Omaha. (wipes off some sweat) Ugh, I am gross, so I'm going to bid you farewell, Tim Lippe. See you at Horizons tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. 33. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you were planning on spying on me in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim reddens, once again going into panic mode. Joan laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I am evil. I need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim tries to think of something clever to say, but just s there with his mouth open. He's never met a woman like th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim finishes showering. He steps out of the shower to fin Orin Helgesson, completely naked. Orin has just exited another shower. He smiles pleasantly at Tim, also naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I... OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I really enjoyed your speech, President Helgesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in there? Marvelous. Did you like the part about E-Commerce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Very much, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific. It's the future y'know. Anyhow, I don't think we've...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim Lippe. Down from Brown Valley, Wisconsin. Northlands Insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of emotion-- maybe even anxiety-- on Orin's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew boy. Tim, what can I say? I just-- we're all feeling it. I'm so sorry for the loss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin puts a supportive hand on Tim's shoulder. 34. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, well, it's rough. Real rough. Like you said in your remarks, Roger wasn't just a great rep, he was a good father and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a pilot. Flew a Cessna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's just rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin gives Tim a hug. Tim juts his butt out so that their penises don't touch. A JANITOR enters the locker room, se this odd embrace, pauses a beat and hurriedly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The embrace runs its course. Tim isn't sure where to look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, I know Bill's looking to retire and from the sound of it he's on the hook for a pretty sweet time share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it sounds pretty top-notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help him find a buyer, and God knows I'll try my darnedest. But-- and it pains me to say this-- there's a petition going around trying to rescind all of Northlands' Two Diamond Awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But let's be honest, one of the core tenets of the Two Diamonds is Commitment to God. And the way Roger passed on... well, some folks are saying that type of activity isn't entirely "godly."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shakes his head, disbelieving. 35. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to understand, this isn't some namby-pamby local event. This is a regional convention, Tim. Now, I want to help you, but you're going to have to help yourself too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin goes to his locker, removes a folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a few extra drink coupons for Horizons. Get down there-- fellowship and network. Buy a few drinks. Let `em see the good side of Northlands Insurance-- the wholesome side, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you President Helgesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Orin. And if you need anything, Tim-- I mean anything-- I'm up in the Tiffany Suite. Room 411. Balcony overlooks the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim accepts the stack of drink tickets. He's scared shitl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HORIZONS BAR & GRILLE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, with taupe turtleneck tucked in to pleated corduroys hesitates at the threshold of Horizons, a brightly lit, aeronautically-themed establishment. The cavernous bar is largely empty. Tim considers his drink coupons.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Timbo! Over here roomie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits alone at the bar. Tim reluctantly goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she hanging Big Tim? Big time Big Tim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Deanzie, c'mon. (shouts at bartender) Ahoy Cap'n, we got a thirsty sailor over here!
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re. the bartender) Kid was in the navy. Seaman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean nudges Tim and laughs as the BARTENDER, 25, approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I getcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Do you guys have root beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a nipple with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, why would I need a nipple...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach, I'm busting your balls. You don't get out much, do you buddy? (spots Tim's drink coupons) Whoa, who'd you have to blow to get all those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't... Nobody. President Helgesson gave them to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smug fuck. Trying to poison my roommate with his B-S propaganda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't... Orin, President Helgesson, he wanted to help me meet people. Just being friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softens, fatherly) Wow-wow-wow, you are naГЇve. A rail cocktail's, what, four bucks? Times that by 10 drink coupons. We're talking 40 large, Tim. Doesn't sound so friendly anymore, does it? Sounds more like one of these I-scratch- your-back-you-scratch-mine deals. (off Tim's confused look) I bet ol' Orin invited you up to the Tiffany Suite, too, hmm? Fourth floor? View of the pool? Yup. (leans in, conspiratorial) Cocksucker's buying your vote, pal. 37. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shudders. Dean gestures for Tim to act natural as Ron enters with a taciturn Latino man, BILL HERNANDEZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronimal! Taco Bill! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Hernandez. I call him Taco Bill. Mexican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lubricated INSURANCE WORKERS are now singing karaoke. Ori and Mike Pyle, the sweater vest guy, sit at a table in ba Orin looks at Tim with concern as Dean regales him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Big Time Tim, what're you looking for pussy-wise here in Cedar CRAPids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that would be nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim displays a photo of Millie (a portrait from the junio high where she teaches) in his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No it is not. Millie and I are engaged. To be married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married yourself, Ziegler. The heck's your moral compass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My moral compass is pointing true north, if you read me. Right Taco Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taco Bill sighs and wanders off to get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, Ronimal-- I was married. Was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh jeez. You and Patti split? Sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely covering the pain) Ah, she's a fucking asshole.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together 17 years. Lucky if one of `em was decent. ASS. FUCKING. HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a weird moment. Dean takes a drink, laughs it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I was talking about anyway, Ronimal, is that from what I can deduce, young Timbo Lippe here has led a-- shall I say-- sheltered existence. And I think we oughta help him, y'know, aroo-aroo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean raises his drink heroically. No one else joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASMI isn't a vacation for everybody, Dean. End of the day, Tim's here to work and to win. For his agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And P-S, I would never, ever have "relations" or whatever with another woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As fate-- that wily minx-- would have it...

dialogues.speaker: JOAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hubba-hubba, check out these studs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Joan Ostrowski-Fox, the woman Tim met in the gym. De and Ronald get up, greet her warmly. Tim looks at his sod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan Ostrowski-Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The O-Fox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan does an ironic, flirtatious curtsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she is, Miss America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fly in from Omaha, Joan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. And boy are my arms tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald giggles, more animated than we've seen him. 39. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really. I drove. Deanzie, let me say... (does Billy Crystal character) ... you look maah-velous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (does a bad Austin Powers) Oh yeah baby. Shag-a-licious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Tim stares ahead, wishing for invisibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, this is the Queen Bee of ASMI, Joan Ostrowski-Fox. The O-Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim turns around, acts like he just now recognizes Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Ha. From the fitness center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! It's Tim "don't get lippy with me" Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, and I was very naughty in there. I'm sorry about that, Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No she's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots! What'll it be, gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, Jaeger time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh what the heck. Drambuie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lippe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't, ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peer pressure! Tim scans the liquor behind the bar, settles on a bottle that looks impressive. 40. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Grenadine? Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan, Ronald and Dean wince as they slam their shots. Tim sips the thick red syrup, surprised by its sweetness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful you don't get too loaded, Lippe, or I might have to take advantage of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan squeezes Tim's thigh. Tim bolts off of his stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a super long day. I, ah, better... Good night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim awkwardly leaves the bar. Dean nudges Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings Hall & Oates) Whoa-o here she comes-- she's a man eater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tim hurries out of the bar, Bree, the woman in the den skirt who Tim met outside enters. She's locking arms with stout INSURER, 49. Tim pauses long enough to say hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Bree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Tim is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie is on the phone in her bathrobe. Her dog sits with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlene's brother's back in the hospital, so bridge got canceled. So we just watched hockey.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: We? 41. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade is still there watching TV. He's drinking a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits on a roll-away bed in his pajamas. He's on his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: He says hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Tell him hey.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Tim says hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of silence. Tim looks irritated.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O. S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I picked up that diet wet food for Brandy today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do some work before bed, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I should let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's-- I love you so bad, babygirl. It's so hard here. I just miss you.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I miss you, too, Tim. But this was your decision. You have to act like a big boy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tss. Yeah, yeah. Keep reminding me.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You'll be fine. Just be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You, too. I love you. 42. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim hangs up, world-weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits on the toilet. His laptop sits on the counter, t Two Diamond presentation on the screen. He practices for full-length mirror on back of the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Current risk mitigation mechanisms available to hog farm operations include futures and options to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door opens. It's Deanzie. Tim shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. This needs to be private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Something didn't agree with you, did it? Second thought, meet me in the stairwell after you wrap things up in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deanzie sips from a mini-bar bottle of rum as Tim, now in flannel bathrobe and slippers, enters the dingy stairwell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like my fuckin' wife, Timbo. Jesus. Ex, I should say. EX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits heavily on the cement stairs. He hiccups, burps Tim looks at Dean with a feeling that borders pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah! (calms himself, whispers) Fuck yeah. But we didn't get to finish our little confab back at the bar. I figured some shit out.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I told you, no shocker-- Helgesson's buttering you up to get you in his camp, because he knows you and me are close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close enough. You're voting for me for President, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well anyway, there's a petition going around trying to take away your company's Two Diamond Awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hear this: After you left the bar, Mike Pyle comes up to me-- Pyle of shit, I call him-- and he asks do I want to sign this thing. And I go, "Lemke might have been a class-A deviant, but the guy was tits as a rep..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon my French, Dean, but that's a bunch of bull roar. My boss, Bill Krogstad? He told me how you called up Joyce ArmbrГјster and smeared Roger's name all over town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce who...? Oh, no-no-no, whoa- whoa-whoa, that old whore called ME. Harping about Lemke being a pervert and how she wants to take her business elsewhere. So I says, "OK, I'll run some numbers." Well, she calls back later that same day, says she got Krogstad to lower her premium. Which is all the greasy twat wanted in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So wait, you didn't call her? 44. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be a lot of things, but poacher ain't one of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim lets this sink in. Dean hiccups and burps again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's with this petition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally? I think Mike Pyle of Shit started the thing as a way to drive down the price of your agency. Dollars to donuts he wants to swoop in and pick up Northlands at a bargain basement price. And you know what else I think? I think Orin's in on the deal somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't quite figure it myself, but I know what I know. And what I know is you're wading into some duvious, er dubious, shit. Just be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks shell-shocked. What a long, long day it's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN JOAN OSTROWSKI-FOX'S ROOM: Joan is bent over her tub applying a Clairol Nice `N' Easy home hair color kit. She gets up, puts on a shower cap . She applies cold cream to face. She looks tired and decidedly middle-aged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN THE HALLWAY: Bree drunkenly escorts a different INSU back to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN THE JUNIOR SUITE BEDROOM: Ronald sleeps soundly, gen snoring. Tim tosses and turns in his cot. He looks out in the living room where he sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deanzie at the desk chair, gently masturbating. We move i see what he's looking at: A photo of a woman in a bikini. She's attractive enough, carrying a few too many pounds. Certainly no supermodel. Pull out to reveal: 45. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman is the subject of a Christmas photo card. The t script reads, Happy Holidays from Dean & Patti Ziegle Christmas `93, Panama City Beach, FLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the woman stands a younger, slimmer Deanzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim holds hands with Ronald and a DOUGHY MAN at a round t in a room full of people holding hands. Orin says a praye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... In Your Name we pray Lord Jesus, Son of God, Author of our Salvation, our Redeemer, our Truth. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. The gathered INSURERS head to the breakfast buffet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin knows how to lead a prayer breakfast, tell you what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm...? Oh. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little overwhelming? All this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, thank you. I feel like my head is gonna like... (makes explosion face) Y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I hear ya L & C. Loud and clear. I was the same way when I first came to ASMI. The deciding which break-out sessions to attend, plus the politics, the pressure, the not knowing who to trust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin catches Tim's eye, gives him a friendly wink. Just t Tim's phone rings. He looks at the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Ronald. It's my boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Tim. 46. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Krogstad talks on the phone as he drives. His wife, DIONE, crochets in the passenger's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim. Bill Krogstad. Got a call from Orin Helgesson. Tells me he's worried about you. Tells me you're palling around with Dean Ziegler. Laughing at his jokes, buying him drinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the ONE thing I told you to do? The one thing, Tim? Steer clear of Dean Ziegler. GODDAMNIT, you're lousing the whole thing up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now Dione.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim tries to get a word in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I... That Dean Ziegler-- he was trying to warn me about Orin.

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Warn you about Orin? Orin Helgesson has been ASMI Midwest Region President for 13 years! He is a LEGEND! And what do you do?! You go and pal around with his sworn enemy-- who, P.S., is a drunken loser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad punches the car roof. 47. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent you to ASMI to restore our image, Tim. One day into the deal you're lousing the whole thing up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how far Gladstone is from Cedar Rapids, Dione. Look in the atlas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not driving to Iowa, Bill. This is your daughter's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh cripes, you know as well as I do that Polack's gonna head for the hills the second he gets his papers. But no, you want to end up in the poor house, Dione, we'll go. Let's just keep on cashing checks we don't have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to our daughter's wedding, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim deflates, actually fighting back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know I did anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Well you better try doing something right, Lippe. Because if you keep lousing up, we all by god starve! And don't you tell me to calm down Dione!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad hangs up. Rattled, Tim hurries for the exit. He in the revolving door when he spots Joan Ostrowski-Fox outside having a cigarette. Rather than face her, Tim kee going in the revolving door. But she sees him and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim does one more turn in the revolving door and steps ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a very bad girl. But I swear I only smoke in Cedar Rapids. Care for a Virginia Slim, Lippe? 48. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim just shakes his head, unable to hide his despondence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, I don't know. Only everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan gives him a kind, gentle smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Joan swing on a swing set in a dreary little park overlooking the Cedar River. It is a cold, gray day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have to yell at me. I didn't do anything wrong. I'm trying my hardest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you want me to kick his butt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I know Krogstad. I could take him. `Sides, I'm a ninja. A nin- jette, actually. Hoo-waaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Lippe, how'd you end up in the insurance game? God that sounded dorky-- insurance game. (does 40s-style Cagney) Look here, see, how'd you end up in the insurance game, see...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are freaky. (laughs, then) No, it's kind of weird how I got interested in insurance, actually. When I was six, my dad got killed in a sawmill accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. 49. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Not good. But after he died, our insurance agent fought like a tiger against the sawmill to make sure me and my mom were taken care of. And we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crazy thing-- our agent was actually Bill Krogstad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had just opened Northlands. Anyway, I remember thinking, this guy's a hero. A real hero. So even if he doesn't always treat me, like y'know... whatever now-- I'll never forget that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim jumps off the swing, taking care not to slip in the s Joan jumps off. They walk toward the river, silent for a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This river-- the Cedar River? It flooded the whole city a couple years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember that. Massive disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People talk about the firemen and policemen and that. But think about all the claims in a disaster like that-- how hard those agents worked to make sure people's lives weren't left in the lurch. We're talking billions of dollars in damages, literally. And claim by claim, dream by dream, those agents helped rebuild this city. I'm telling you, it's a noble calling. I really believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize you just made it sound cool to be an insurance salesman? You are a hero, Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tss. I wish. 50. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can tell. You're the Superman type. Kind of dweeby on the surface but a real frickin' stud underneath. They'd call you Insurance Man-- put a big red "I" on your chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, even if you're being full of it, thanks for saying that anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can you fly me back to the hotel, Insurance Man? I'm freezing my arse off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, sufficiently cheered up. She snaps her fingers starts heading back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Orin argue. Ronald tries to stay out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying a Bridge to the 22nd Century is a stupid theme, Helgesson. Not a goddamn one of us is even going to be alive in the 22nd Century...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and I suppose under a Dean Ziegler administration, we'd just abandon E-Commerce and all that, huh? What's your take, Ronald?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the day, you know I'm a big supporter of yours, Orin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stab me in the fucking back why don't you, Wilkes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I stab you in the back, Dean, when I'm telling you to your face that I think you'd be a lousy President? 51. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That deflates the tension. The three men are laughing as approaches. Dean spots him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
