dialogues.text: Timbo! Sorry about that gigantic boner I got while we were spooning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim freezes, looks at Orin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't spoon, Orin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To each his own, Tim. (gives Tim a kind wink) I'm teasing, of course. Well, I gotta run to an Executive Council meeting. You fellas really ought to check out Mike Pyle's Prop/Cas seminar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pyle of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's a dynamite orator. I think you'd enjoy it. We'll see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smug fuck. (then, to Tim & Ronald) So who's ready for a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 11 in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 11 in the morning. Can you believe this guy? C'mon Timbo, let's get the flock outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Ronald watch curiously as Tim practically runs a 52. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, Ronald and Joan sit on folding chairs in the front r Mike Pyle, his creamy skin offset by an aquamarine sweate vest, speaks with subdued energy to the half-full room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to share a humorous anecdote. A gentleman is drowning in a lake or pond, and he's 20 feet offshore. Well, along comes an actuary. And this actuary sees the drowning gentleman and throws him an 11 foot rope. And the gentleman says, "But I'm 20 feet offshore!" And the actuary says, "Well, I'm meeting you MORE than halfway."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room busts up laughing. Tim takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE PYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So Property/Casualty Insurance, or Prop/Cas, it's one of the most dynamic areas of our industry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Pyle pauses as a HOTEL CLERK enters, whispers someth to him and hands him a note. Mike reads the note.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE PYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, is there a Tim Lip in here? There's an emergency call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks concerned as he rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim takes the phone from the DESK CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herro Mr. Tim, my name Chin Chang. There bad news about your fiancГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie? Something happened...?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Ah, you wise man Mr. Tim. She die in horrible car accident... 53. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's stomach drops.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: ... but her dying wish for you, Mr. Tim, to get shit-face with Deanzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip pan to reveal Dean on another house phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timbo! Turn around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim turns, sees Dean. A torrent of anger rises. Tim charg at Dean. He shoves him. Dean is a much larger man and is therefore impervious to Tim's inelegant, girlish assault. Despite the low-key nature of the melee, it draws the attention of Trent, the desk clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen! I will call security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim deflates. He gives Dean one more shove. Dean laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the H did I ever do to you, you a-hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim walks away. Dean calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on bud, I was having fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits on his cot. He is on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to hear your voice.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Brandy, no! Bad girl! Sorry, she's giving me grief over this new wet food. What did you need now, Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing really...

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Well I for one feel like I ought to be on the fire department, I'm putting out so many fires. Lucy Kofnetka asked me to do altar guild for her. Again. 54. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Patti told me Lucy's seeing some guy who doesn't even go to church, so she apparently feels no need to maintain her responsibil... Brandy! No! She's going number two on the floor! No! You get outside! I'll call you later, Tim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. He exhales. He looks out the window: An Applebee's. A Super Target. Traffic on the distant inters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is bubbling in Tim-- maybe not cauldron of lava more like a cup of soup left in the microwave a bit too l But still, there's a boiling, churning glow behind his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim determinedly enters a banquet room where VENDORS have up booths. He approaches a WOMAN at a table with a sign t says Met Life Scavenger Hunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to sign up for the scavenger hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super. Teaming with a co-worker or are you in need of a partner? (off Tim's look) This is a team event, like the Amazing Race. On TV? But instead of going around the world, you look for stuff in Cedar Rapids. And instead of a million dollars, the winning team gets a $75 gift card for Westdale, which is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eastern Iowa's largest two-story mall. I know. Sweet. (a thought, a moment) And yes, I do have a teammate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald and Joan exit the Seminar. They spot Tim. 55. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what was that call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. Say Joan, you have something on your blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan looks down at her blouse. Tim flicks her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very weird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bad Elvis impersonation) Thank you. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, ah, I signed you up for the Scavenger Hunt. To be my teammate. In the Scavenger Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well I... Because Ronald already had a teammate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Hernandez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taco Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And I thought you'd-- we'd-- be y'know, a decent team. So... (then, firm) I think you should do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heck yeah! I get to be Insurance Man's sidekick. We're going to kick some ASS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few PEOPLE look curiously at Joan. Tim stands up a bit straighter. This is good. This is good. 56. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin, in a theme-appropriate safari hat, addresses the 10 TEAMS. Among them: Tim & Joan, Ronald & Taco Bill & a FRIZZY-HAIRED WOMAN. Dean is absent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like last year there'll be a few physical challenges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am super pumped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoo-hoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course this should be considered a fun event, in the spirit of team building. You can find your first clue "under the sea." By which I mean in the pool area. So ready, set, race!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the teams take off for the pool, Dean enters. Tim paus long enough to say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going down, a-hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Dean's partner, a MAN in an electric wheelchai PERRY KUHN, 29, rolls in. They high five and whoo-hoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's roll, Perry-- Perry-plegic. Get it, like paraplegic? But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good one, Dean-tard. Like retard, but Dean-tard. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean laughs as he and Perry follow the other contestants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pool is large and reasonably impressive, with a slide lawn furniture, a whirlpool and a video arcade nearby. Th contestants rush in. Tim spots something on the bottom of pool. A series of bricks spell out: PLANET X. 57. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out-- Planet X!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim unzips his hidden cummerbund/money belt. He pulls out small laminated packet, held together with metal rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I compiled a ton of info on Cedar Rapids. I've got a sweet laminator in my basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, that's hot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips through his packet) ... Maps, area attractions, crime stats, local customs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo! Right here-- Planet X Family Fun Center. Let's go. Act natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan cracks up. They walk out casually. For good measure:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a gyp. There are no stinkin' clues in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Joan laugh as he peels out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I think we're going to want to take Blair's Ferry Road to Avenue C, then probably east on 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you possibly know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I memorized the major thoroughfares and landmarks in the metro area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather than say anything, Joan just shakes her head and t on the radio. GROOVE IS IN THE HEART kicks in, providing
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, Joan and the other teams bound through a huge, Marti themed ball pit. They start digging through the balls. Pe sits dejectedly off to the side in his wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Ronald shove past Mike Pyle, knocking him down. T is the first to discover a foam "moon rock" amid the ball The rock reads, "ASMI ROCKS!" Taped to the bottom, a mess

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You've seen the future, now Czech out Cedar Rapid's past." But it's Czech, like Czechoslovakia. C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AT THE NATIONAL CZECH MUSEUM: A traditionally costumed CZECH WOMAN, 80, shows Tim and Joan how to paint an EGG. egg is lovely, with intricate patterns and vibrant colors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN THE CAR: Joan reads through Tim's laminated booklet he drives. She's really getting into it, too. Tim's phone keeps ringing. It's Millie. He ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN A GYMNASIUM: Ronald awkwardly tries to make a basket becomes upset when he misses. Joan swishes a 3-pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AT A DAIRY FARM: The teams milk cows. Mike Pyle is particularly proficient. Dean can't help himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what that cow's thinking, Pyle? She's thinking, "quit pulling on my tits and fuck me already."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN A PARKING LOT: Dean loads Perry into a handicap- accessible van as Mike Pyle and his partner blow past the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AT THE IOWA PORK SHRINE: Joan gobbles down hot dogs in speed eating contest. Tim cheers her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. I'm gonna puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're doing great, Joan. And you look super awesome with a wiener in your mouth. 59. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, mouth full) Oh my God, did you just make a dick joke, Lippe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (giggles, with pride) Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan bites seductively into her hot dog. The others are c behind. Except Ronald's partner, Taco Bill, who is vomiti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is low. Long, phallic shadows are cast by a serie 70-foot silos which are covered with thick sheets of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Joan run up to Orin, who is waiting by the silos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK guys, this is it. First team to complete this challenge wins the whole shootin' match. (unfurls a scroll, reads) ASMI's past is behind us; But our future looks nice; Let's Build a Bridge to the 22nd Century... by scaling this silo of ice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some DUDES with ice climbing equipment-- ropes, picks, et appear. Tim looks petrified. Joan shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't even... There's no such thing as silo ice climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's actually a big thing in Iowa. ABC news did a story about it. I saw it on YouTube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you did. Well, you can do it then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh, absolutely not. I'm scared crapless of heights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get over it, Lippe, cuz I'm not climbing jack.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Insurance Man-- leap tall buildings in a single bound and all that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's nostrils flair. Just then, Mike Pyle and his partne arrive. Tim looks to the top of the silo. It is dizzyingl high. He shuts his eyes for a moment, exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's do this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin turns on a boom box, which blasts some triumphant mu (Whitesnake's HERE I GO AGAIN, perhaps).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS: The Dudes get Tim and Mike Pyle into their climbing gear-- harnesses, helmets, crampons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they start climbing. Sort of. Tim jams his pick into ice. He tries to pull himself up, but can't. Mike fares worse. He can't even get his pick to stick in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on... How's it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little help here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dudes shout instructions. Tim and Mike try again. To avail. Neither could do a pull-up if his life depended on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the contestants have shown up. But not a damn one of can get more than a foot off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. This is frickin' hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just shit my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan cheers. Orin looks to the Dudes, who shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin talks on his cell phone, conferring. The contestants wait in a field, shivering. The sun is getting lower. Ori hangs up, sighs, shuts off the uplifting music. 61. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK gang, that was Rick Martini with the National Chapter. Here's the deal. Since no one could do the final task, and since Joan and Tim were the first team to get here, we're just gonna go ahead and award them the first place prize. Unless anyone's got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald mutters to himself, frustrated with his performanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dangit. You could've done better, Wilkes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, we won?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. So here you guys go. Your $75 gift card for the Westdale Mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin hands Joan the gift card. Despite the anticlimax, Ti overjoyed. He picks up Joan and spins her around. Everyon else just wanders away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim is ebullient. Joan rides shotgun. The screen on Tim's phone says that he's missed 11 calls. It rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh crap. I forgot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Millie.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I have been trying to reach you for the last eight hours, Timothy. I was going to call the police. Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mil. I signed up for this scavenger hunt, and check it out-- we won! My teammate and I, that is. Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Millie! 62. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Joan saying hi. (beat, to Joan) Millie says hi.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I did not say hi. I didn't say anything. If you had asked, I would have told you that I've been at the vet half the day because Brandy swallowed a pencil eraser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something dawns on Tim-- who gives a shit. He glances at and her skirt and her exposed knee.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Lucky for us it came out naturally or we'd have been looking at surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pulls into a spot in the Westdale Mall parking lot. H gestures for Joan to wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just meet you inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Mil, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie looks wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's this Joan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some gal from Omaha they paired me up with. Between you and me, she's a little different. Real hyper-- one of these types who kind of overdoes it. But for a 75 dollar gift card, I'm not going to complain. 63. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You promised you'd check in with me. I'm very disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. It's as though a profound revelation has just slipped out. As if, in an instant, everything has changed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie's heart sinks. She looks at her Beanie Babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You obviously have more important things to do than talk to me. My brother and I were just getting ready to go for fish at the Eagles anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal: Wade is sitting in his rightful throne, watching aerobics show on TV. Millie snaps at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go warm up the car, Wade.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Mil, I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. You'll call me some time when it's convenient for you, Tim. Good Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie hangs up. Wade gives her a supportive shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim snaps his phone shut. What just happened? He consider his options for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan window shops at a LensCrafters. Tim approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What say we just use the gift certificate to get a nice supper here? At the mall. 64. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan smiles at him, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim approaches the Olive Garden MAГЋTRE D'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a gift card. But I didn't make a reservation. Is that OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save for three tables of ELDERLY PEOPLE, the place is emp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim raises his eyebrows to Joan-- not too shabby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Joan are seated in a candlelit booth. Opera Muzak tinkles. If you didn't know this to be a mall-based chain you might think it a romantic Italian restaurant. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An acne-scarred WAITER, 21, approaches with a tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coors Lite for the madam. A cream sherry for monsieur. And here are some bottomless bread sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter exits. Tim raises his glass for a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To victory. To new friends. To life. And all the joys of living it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really nice. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink glasses. Tim takes a dainty sip of his sherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, it does taste a lot like communion wine. Awesome. 65. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan feeds Tim a bite of her lasagna. A bit sticks to his chin. She wipes it off, semi-seductively. Tim laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Lippe, I'm trying to figure you out. Hopes, dreams, aspirations, blah-blah-blah? Whaddaya got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine? Let's see. Um. I would love-- some day-- to put a little greenhouse in my backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream the impossible dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've actually seen some fairly decent portable ones at Fleet Farm that won't break the bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man. I mean fantasy-land stuff. What do you really want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. He takes a sip of sherry, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I always hoped I could take over Northlands when Bill retired. But that obviously isn't going to happen now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, screw him. He wants to sell, why don't you just buy Northlands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? You could get a loan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the business. You know the clients. You actually care about your job. You'd be perfect. 66. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrrr. Ha. Time out. Sheesh. Let's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. What I'd really like is a family. To be a dad. So kids, I guess, that's what I really want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, you can have mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan takes out her Blackberry. The screensaver is a famil portrait: Joan, a MAN with a goatee, and TWO CUTE KIDS. A of them are dressed in denim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler's ten. Ashley'll be eight next month. My little squirrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome. Beautiful kids. And that's...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hubby. Rich Fox. Richie. We met when we were both Rotary exchange students in high school. Lived in Norway for a semester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was such a spaz. Band geek, total ugly duckling-- braces, acne, the whole nine. I didn't even get boobs until college. Anyway, we ended up getting married sophomore year. Then kids. Then blah-blah-blah, and here we are. Richie's a Supervisor in the Parks Department now. For the County.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim doesn't hide his shock well. Joan sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's effed up. And if I had it all to do over again, I don't know what I'd choose.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't have that option. So this is my fantasy-land, Tim. Cedar Rapids. ASMI. This. I come here, and for a few days I'm someone else. No kids. No husband. No responsibility. Wild woman. (an ironic growl) Sometimes a gal just needs a vacation from who she really is-- know what I mean, Lippe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim nods but looks more confused than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim drives. The Olive Garden doggie bag sits in Joan's la Silence, other than the radio. After a bit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I thought of another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish. Or dream or whatever. It's still small potatoes compared to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's hear it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to all you've done-- Norway and all that, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you watch American Idol ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be on American Idol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Without any more ado, our keynote speaker, Iowa Insurance Commissioner, Mrs. Susan Voss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes nuts. As Orin leaves the stage he spots Tim waiting in the wings. Tim gestures for Orin to come outsi 84. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin, stone-faced, approaches Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Helgesson, please let me stay in the Two Diamond contest. Please. This isn't for me-- it's for Bill Krogstad. I can't let him down. Please just let me compete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Orin nods, almost imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Orin silently ride the elevator to the fourth flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin opens the door to the Tiffany Suite, a slightly larg version of the Junior Suite. He ushers Tim inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-deprecating, but proud) Tiffany Suite. Bit much. Perks of the Presidency, guess you'd say. Please. Have a seat on the davenport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits. Orin goes to the mini-fridge, takes out a Sprit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin opens the Sprite, drinks. He reaches into a briefcas He hands Tim a document with dozens of signatures on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the petition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shakes his head as he reads the names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between you and me-- this was a ploy by Mike Pyle. Trying to drive down the value of Northlands so he could get it on the cheap. 85. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Deanzie predicted. Orin snatches back the petitio He rips it in two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made that happen. Poof. Gone. Rainmaker. (makes rain gesture) Northlands keeps its three previous Two Diamond Awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, really? Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin sits next to Tim on the couch, closer than he needs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing Roger Lemke knew, Tim? He knew that when you get all dolled up, go to the prom-- the Big Dance-- that you gotta be prepared to put out. To show a little teat. (off Tim's confused look) You ever hear of PayPal, Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PayPal? Um, yeah. I've used it to pay for Beanie Babies on E-Bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my fiancГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Thing you gotta ask yourself now is this: "Am I ready to dance? Am I ready to show a little TEAT?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Orin. I'm sorry. Please, let's talk E-Commerce for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim hesitantly follows Orin to the desk. A laptop sits op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years ago, the brain trust at ASMI National mandated we go "on- line" for everything. Billing, newsletter, the whole shebang. Now I'm almost 70-years-old-- I's about as likely to figure this deal out as I was to learn Chinese. Well, as you know Roger Lemke was a real whiz on the computer... 86. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Roger's up here looking over this new system, and he gets one of these lightbulb-going-off kinda looks, the way he did. And he says, "Orin, with that newsletter going digital you're saving almost four grand a year in printing costs alone. Four grand. Pure profit." You see where this is going, Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say that I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PayPal. That's where. What has ASMI ever given Orin Helgesson? Huh? Not dime one. Sure as shoot not an opportunity to serve on the National Board. Have I not been a good President? Do I not deserve a little something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an awesome President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're GODDAMN right I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin pounds his fist on the desk. Tim swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know the first blessed thing about this PayPal deal. Roger had the on-line know-how, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still not reading you here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't printing costs anymore, see? The ASMI-teer's digital. E- Commerce! Don't you get it, Tim? All that money-- almost 39-hundred dollars a year-- that goes into a PayPal account now. My PayPal account. But I've got no idea how to use it. 87. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you literally mean you just need help, like, getting on-line, or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your performance in that scavenger hunt was first-rate. Then I see you in the pool making love to that floozy, I realize maybe you've got a bit of Lemke's, shall we say, moral ambiguity. I need that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about stealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pontoon boats don't pay for themselves, Tim. Roger Lemke came to the prom. He showed me a little teat. I rewarded him with the Two Diamonds three years running. I'm prepared to do the same for you. What do you say? You take home those those Two Diamonds, Northlands' value skyrockets, Bill Krogstad retires to his time share. Everybody wins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push in on Tim-- at the crossroads of all crossroads. Outside, a clap of thunder booms ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be doing it for Northlands-- to keep it in Brown Valley and help my co-workers. To help Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks away, avoiding eye contact. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you need me to do exactly...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin claps once, smiles like a proud grandparent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, marvelous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean has dozens of Hello My Name Is stickers with "Deanzi For President!" written on them. He forces one on a WOMAN 88. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vote for Deanzie. Vote for change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well fuck you very much, Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman shakes her head and walks away. Ronald approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can count on your vote tomorrow, right Ronimal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a snowball's chance in Hades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all a bunch of dicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spots Tim O.S.) Hey there, Hangover Harry. 18 hours and counting. Got your guns loaded for the Two Diamonds, partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's guilt is apparent in his awkward demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. I... I don't know about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous. You'll do fine. There's a prayer circle tonight before the entertainment program-- might help ease your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about... Ronald. Just... about everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim abruptly walks away. Dean and Ronald look at each oth perplexed, as Tim exits the hotel into the pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold, hard rain falls as Tim walks from the Holidome to an Applebee's across the busy street. 89. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim enters and walks to the bar. He's soaking wet and loo despondent. A cheery female bartender, KAY, 40, greets hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Saturday! What'cha drinkin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large cream sherry, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she pours a healthy glass of sherry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you could use some cheering up. What do you call it when it rains chickens and ducks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fowl weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim slams the sherry in one gulp-- to Kay's dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another please. I have to use the little boy's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay watches as Tim heads for the bathroom. He leaves his phone on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pees at the urinal. He zips up, goes to wash his hand In the mirror, he's shocked to see: A squinty, drugged ou MAN, 25, exit the stall, followed by... Bree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree? (off her confused look) It's Tim Lippe. From the ASMI convention. We met out in front of the Holidome across the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree coughs a hacking, phlegmy cough. She's very out of i 90. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you get from smoking all those-- what'd you call `em, heaters? Smoker's cough. Ha. Just kidding. Butterscotch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes a few hard candies from his pocket. She takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small world, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally. You wanna party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, that's really awesome of you to ask. But I have a super important presentation in the morning unfortunately, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squinty-eyed man, GARY, who has been drinking out of sink, looks up at Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta work in the morning, too. Can't be productive or whatever without occasionally taking a little ride on the good times express. It's like, fuck that shit, yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I hear that. L & C. Loud and... clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. We're going to this thing at my Uncle Ken's later-- after his shift's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree examines Tim, standing stiffly, hands in his pockets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're in serious need of some relaxation, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree nonchalantly pinches his nose. Tim looks oddly touch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have had a pretty messed up day actually. Might not hurt to forget about it for a little while. 91. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Pyle, in a bold chartreuse sweater vest, quietly con with Orin outside a conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My advice, Mike? Pull the trigger. I've pretty well convinced him that his company's in the crapper. 85- thousand is as low as I could possibly get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's said nothing to indicate I'd have to hang onto his employees or the office up there, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill was real clear about that. You're buying his clients-- not his brand. You've done this before, Mike. The Northlands policies will simply roll over into your Allstate office in Milwaukee. Unless you want to keep a satellite branch up there in North Palookaville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let's pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Mike-- we're square on my consultant's fee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten percent, as agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvelous. Now just give me a second here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin enters the conference room alone. He un-mutes a speakerphone. The Chicken Dance Polka blares from the oth end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all systems go over here, Bill. 92. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Praise Christ! This is super, Orin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was able to get Pyle up to 81- thousand for you, Bill, which is pretty amazing given all the... the tribulations and that. Of course that number doesn't include my 15 percent consultant's fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEDDING GUESTS do the chicken dance. Krogstad strains to heard over the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what Orin, it's only a seven hour drive to Cedar Rapids. If I leave right now, I can be there first thing in the A-M and we can lock this sonofagun down.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want to put you out, Bill, but it would be nice to put pen to paper on a contract sooner than later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes. You bet. It's no problem. I'll be there in time to see the Two Diamond presentations-- not that that matters to me anymore! Thanks a million, Orin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad clicks off his phone, pumps his fist, overjoyed. approaches his wife.

dialogues.speaker: BILL KROGSTAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dione, the deal's going through! 81- grand! We're getting this albatross off our backs after all. I'm going to Cedar Rapids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Dione, not now. This is happening. No flex on this one! 93. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad hustles out of the reception hall. The fleshy br and her oily groom watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, a JACK NICHOLSON IMPERSONATOR does a lame routi

dialogues.speaker: JACK NICHOLSON IMPERSONATOR
dialogues.text: ... You can't handle the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter. Joan and Ronald are in the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to get bands, Ronald. Real bands. Kansas. REO Speedwagon... Remember REO let me get on stage and play tambourine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go ahead and admit, this is an odd choice for an ASMI headliner. Budget crunch, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: JACK NICHOLSON IMPERSONATOR
dialogues.text: Danny isn't here Mrs. Torrance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean urgently approaches Joan and Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready for this? Mike Pyle of Shit just bought Northlands. Word is the cocksucker's liquidating Timbo and the whole Brown Valley operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Holy smokes. Does Tim know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. I don't think Tim likes me very much anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cry me a fucking river, honey. This isn't about you for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Dean. Jackass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Come on you guys. Cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd guffaws as faux Jack does his thing. 94. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: JACK NICHOLSON IMPERSONATOR
dialogues.text: I said, I'm not gonna hurt ya. I'm just going to bash your brains in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pall overtakes the room-- this used to be fun. Now it's just kind of sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are a couple of serious fucking downers, man. Timbo left here in a huff a few hours ago-- you saw him Ronimal. Maybe he already knew. Shit, the kid's one of my best friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You met him two days ago, Ziegler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what, blow me Ronald. It's not my fault you're too goddamn afraid to open up and tell another man you love him. Do what you want, but the Deanzie's gonna make sure his friend is doing OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boston's MORE THAN A FEELING blares on the radio of a pic truck. Tim politely rocks out, sandwiched between Bree an Gary in the front seat. A violent-looking, wire-thin man an Applebee's uniform, UNCLE KEN, 40, drives. After a bit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be pretty all right, Ken, getting half off at Applebee's all the time. I'd only weigh like 10- thousand pounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass me that cube, Skeet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary opens the glove box, passes Ken a glass pipe. Ken li up, takes a hit, passes it to Bree. Bree follows suit, th passes the pipe to Tim. Tim looks at it, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...? This would be marijuana, I'm guessing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then they all laugh like crazy. So Tim laughs, to Bree puts the pipe in Tim's mouth. He looks frightened. 95. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck the glass dick, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Bree lights the pipe. Tim inhales and instant oh fuck, Oh Fuck, OH FUCK! Tim's eyes bulge, his teeth gr Then he shakes his head like a wet dog and violently COUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh jeez, oh jeez, oh jeez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A butterscotch might help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean has his phone to his ear. Ronald and Joan watch.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to reach Tim Lippe. Who am I talking to?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: This is Kay over at the Applebee's. Your friend left his phone here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right? Is he there now?

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: No he's not. Be honest, I was kinda worried about the little guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of shots as Tim-- sweaty, high and extremely hyp dances with Bree to the deafening death metal. The party volatile mix of BIKER TYPES and SPEED FREAKS. Even though salmon-colored oxford shirt has come untucked from his ca slacks, Tim still looks a tad out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following conversation is shouted because of the musi
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sure he heard right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pauses. Then-- what the heck. He unzips his money bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, Ronald and Joan look worried as they listen to Kay, friendly Applebee's bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I say, he was pretty ripped from all that sherry. He left with Ken and them for some party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Ken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken's our cook. We all think he deals dope, though. I get along good with everyone. But Ken? He's just real different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh jeez. D'you know where they were going? Any idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could try Ken's place. It's way out in the boonies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree snorts a line in a disgusting, fetid bathroom. Tim s on the counter. He's jacked up, sweaty and very chatty. 97. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom became real protective of me after my dad passed. She didn't really let me play sports or any of that. Fact, if I think about it, I never really did much of anything. Except gardening, which I do enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're livin' now. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers Tim a line. He declines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought some pills, too. Here. These'll make you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a couple pills. He pops them without thinki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. It's funny, though, because my job is all about protecting other people's dreams. But what about my dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be like-- maybe... (does another line) Whoa, shit's tight... Like maybe it has to do with your parents both dying? Like, maybe by protecting other people-- it's like you're trying to save your parents. Like somehow you feel like it's your fault? Like in your sub-conscience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something struck a nerve with Tim. He chokes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so you're not really like, living your own life fully? But dude, let me tell you this: the only real insurance in this life-- is love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That did it. Now Tim is weeping. Bree notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby, c'mere. C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fuck my ass if you want. 98. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Tim can respond to that, the door bursts open. It' Uncle Ken, and he is NOT happy. Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad chugs coffee as he drives through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin and Mike Pyle laugh as they raise a glass for a toas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean's minivan pulls into the gravel driveway of the dilapidated, isolated farmhouse. We can tell it's the par house by the music blasting and the DEGENERATES on the po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Joan climb out of the minivan. The rain is falli harder. Ronald slides open the back door and climbs out. has on a long black rain coat. He nearly slips on some ic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. This place is bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Ken grabs Tim and shoves him out into the hall. Tim trips over a WASTED TEEN GIRL and stumbles against the wa

dialogues.speaker: WASTED TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: Faggot. Watch out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree looks legitimately worried for Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, Joan and Ronald formulate a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be standing by `case things get squirrelly in there. Getaway vehicle type scenario. 99. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're sending me into that shithole? How chivalrous, Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me can go in, Joan. It'll be fine, I'm sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Ken drags Tim into a kitchen full of PARTYGOERS gat around a keg of Natural Ice. He shoves Tim face first aga the wall. Tim takes this opportunity to notice the peelin wallpaper, which surprisingly has the same floral pattern his own kitchen wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald and Joan approach the front door. Judging from the looks on the faces of the DUDES on the porch, black folks not a common sight at this residence. Gary, the squinty-e guy Tim met in the bathroom with Bree, ogles Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not missing a beat) Thanks. Thank you. That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want any trouble, guys. We're just looking for our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dudes let Joan and Ronald pass into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean sits silently in the driver's seat. The quiet gets t him. He starts humming, then mumble-sings to himself and drums the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-mow-mow... Two tickets to paradise. Hmm-hmm, pack your bags we'll leave tonight... 100. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan and Ronald make their way through the house, clockin the aggressively angry looks as they go. Joan sees someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE KITCHEN: Uncle Ken is choking Tim. The PARTYGOERS cheer. Uncle Ken punches Tim in the stomach. Tim falls to filthy linoleum. Bree protests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he paid for it, Uncle Ken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let some dude pay for crystal meth and an ass fuck with a traveler's check, Bree. That shit can be traced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fully insured. 100 percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we didn't make love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks Tim hard. It's looking bad, when all of a sudden

dialogues.speaker: RONALD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to see Ronald. In the black trench coat, he actually looks BAD ASS. He has one hand in the coat pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard-core gangsta speak) I may look like some suit wearin' businessman to y'all. Truth is, I'm straight up gangsta. And I always keeps one in the chamber... (indicates the bulge in his pocket) ... in case you ponderin'. So I suggest for the time being that you let my nigga be. Muthafucka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Ken blinks a few times. Then he lets Tim get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed. 101. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald takes Tim's arm. Joan joins them. The three of the walk backwards toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is outside the minivan, taking a leak on a tree. He looks toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald, Tim and Joan exit the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run for Dean's minivan. Tim slips, sliding across th snow and mud. Ronald drags him halfway across the lawn be Tim finally gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, meanwhile, tries to finish peeing as he makes his w back to the van-- doing a sort of crab walk to avoid piss on himself. Tim, Ronald and Joan dive into the minivan. D climbs back into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bree and gang exit the house and watch as Dean peels out, tossing up bits of gravel as he speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean looks nervously in the rearview mirror-- all clear. Ronald tries to calm Tim down in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Tim. Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know. All I know is I was getting kicked and then Ronald was there talking like a ghetto person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean looks at Joan and Ronald-- What? 102. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to extricate Tim from what was clearly a volatile situation, I did, in fact, rely on my community theater training. I don't like to brag, but I do a pretty convincing Omar from the HBO program, The Wire. (beat, as a gangsta) Least them crackers back yonder seemed to buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ronimal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minivan speeds through the dark, rainy night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits on the couch bouncing his legs, still messed up. Joan sits with him. Dean and Ronald watch, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Bill would do this to me. He was like a father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't just Krogstad, Timbo. Orin's the real devil in this deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan shoots Dean a look-- shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find another job, Lippe. Maybe even move to a new town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, you could come work for me if you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some reason, Tim finds this funny. He laughs hysteric

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dean & Ronald) Get some sleep you guys. I'll stay up with him-- make sure he doesn't chew his arm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald sighs, nods. Dean kisses Tim's sweaty forehead. 103. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep good, little friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Ronald head for the bedroom. Tim looks at Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't make love to Bree, Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Here, lie down, Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim rests his head on Joan's lap. His eyes are still on f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear, what can the matter be Johnny's so long at the fair. He promised to bring me a pocket of posies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shuts his eyes. Joan must be a good mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCKING sound fades in, providing a:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin stirs in his king-size bed. The knocking is at his d He gets out of bed, puts on a robe and goes to the door. peeks through the eyehole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Tim. Just a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin glances in the mirror, smooths his hair. He undoes t chain and opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim bursts in and attacks! Orin, being relatively frail, immediately tumbles to the carpet. This can't be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad yawns but drives with determination as his car passes a sign that reads CEDAR RAPIDS - 100 MILES. 104. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Ronald sleep soundly in their beds. We drift off them to the couch, where Joan has fallen asleep. She wake realizes that Tim is no longer there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first hints of daylight illuminate the eastern sky. K Loggins' WHENEVER I CALL YOU FRIEND plays on the radio. T still hopped up, drives. He enthusiastically sings along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet love showin' us a heavenly light. I never seen such a beautiful sight! See love glowin' on us every night, I know forever we'll be doin' it right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim drives past a farm and sees dozens of hogs foraging around in a sloppy pen. He stomps the brakes, sliding dangerously onto the muddy shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim gets out of the car. The peppy song is still playing. sings along as he dances to the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wanna call you "friend!" Sweet love showin' us a heavenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim opens up the trunk. That's when we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE TRUNK: Orin, in his pajamas, bound and gagged Holiday Inn bedsheets. His shouts are muffled by the gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim pulls Orin from the trunk. Orin's feet are tied toget so he has to hop as Tim leads him toward the hog farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. It's super slippery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin falls face first into the muddy ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoop. Careful now. 105. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim helps Orin to his feet. Several enormous HOGS rush to them on the other side of a barbed wire fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified, through gag) Nmmmmmmmmm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a ton of research on hog farm risk mitigation. Don't worry-- they might bite you a little if they think you're a food source. But there's never been a recorded hog- bite death. So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great difficulty, Tim picks up Orin. Then, he awkwar hurls him over the barbed wire fence. Orin lands on his b in a deep pile of mud and hog shit. The hogs descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Two Diamonds may be meaningless to you and Bill. But there are people who care about this stuff. Ronald Wilkes. Even Dean. Honest, good people. I'll come back for you after the Two Diamonds have been handed out to a legitimate winner. I'm really sorry about this, Orin, but the insurance industry deserves better than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim goes to his car, leaving Orin wriggling with the hogs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUSBAND and WIFE sleep. Their phone rings. They stir. T clock says 6:45 AM. The woman rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the heck's calling at this hour on a Sunday morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man answers the phone. (NOTE: We should now recognize couple as the clients Tim dealt with in the Northlands conference room.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (O.S. ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Kurt Gambsky, Tim Lippe-- your insurance agent. How's Pam and the girls? 106. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to wife) Tim Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, fine, Tim. We're fine. Everything OK by you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim talks on his cell as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think everything's OK. Hope it is anyway. Listen Kurt, here's why I'm calling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eagle soars on a large video screen. A patriotic anthe plays. We boom down from the screen to find Ronald. He's stage finishing up his Two Diamond presentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People sometimes say that promises are cheap. You know what Ronald Wilkes says to that? N-S-F. Not so fast. At the end of the day, a man's word is a sacred creed. And the word I give you at Ronald Wilkes Insurance is-- I will work for you. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words, "Ronald Wilkes Insurance: Working For You" app on screen. Ronald's face dissolves over the eagle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD goes nuts, applauding wildly. Dean and Joan sta standing ovation. Ronald, though exhausted, beams on stag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim is nowhere to be found. An EXECUTIVE COUNCIL MEMBER addresses the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE COUNCIL MEMBER
dialogues.text: Once again folks, President Helgesson left a note under my door this morning saying he had to leave ASMI early due to a family emergency. I haven't been able to reach him on his mobile, but obviously our thoughts and prayers go out to Orin and his family.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE COUNCIL MEMBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a moment of silence) Now... we're set to hear our final Two Diamond presenter. Tim Lip from Northlands Insurance. Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan, Dean and Ronald exchange worried looks. Dean stands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Travis, I don't think Tim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Tim appears. He is filthy-- covered in mud, sw hog shit and tears. He futilely smooths his hair and trie tuck in his shirt as he takes the stage to sparse applaus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim goes to the computer set up on stage for Power Point. puts in his disc. His presentation appears on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'm Tim Lippe. Hog farm risk mitigation... What is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim knocks a folder off the podium. Papers fly everywhere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth move, Ex-Lax. (a few chuckles) So, Hog... No. I, ah... this girl I met, sorry woman, I guess. She's 23. She takes drugs, and I think might be some kind of prostitute. (a collective gasp) But she's super insightful. Y'know what she said to me last night? Said the only real insurance is love. That's fricking INTENSE, isn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward murmurs. At this moment, a very pleased Bill Krog walks in with Mike Pyle. Krogstad tenses, however, when h sees Tim's state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... ah... Our only true safety net. Love. Crazy. I believe in insurance. I believe in love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim laughs. He looks up and sees Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill! Bill Krogstad. My former boss, everybody. 108. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing, Lippe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do this, Bill? I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krogstad chuckles, preferring to avoid any public drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it, Bill? Why'd you do it? Why'd you lie, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the audience) Sorry, folks. Guess it's against the law now for a business owner to sell his own business. Must've missed that constitutional amendment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This draws chuckles from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance isn't just a business, Bill. Insurance is personal. I've got some savings. I could've gotten a loan. We could've worked something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still playing to the crowd) Yeah, there's a guy you want running an agency, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Tim, you're tired. You're looking foolish here. You couldn't run an agency if your life depended on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's lip starts to quiver, and with great effort:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, Bill. Screw you... hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bunch of dog crap. You and Lemke, that... fucking pervert... you stole my ideas and called them your own for years. And I didn't say squat-- because I figured we were like a family. I may not have quite as many clients as Roger had. But my people are loyal, Bill.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care about them. And guess what, they care about me. Fact, I've called more than half of them already this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself, Lippe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew which ones would be on their way to church, which ones I'd be waking up, which ones probably got a little blotto last night and might be hung over... And every single person I talked to-- every one-- is staying with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do actually. I do know, Bill. And before the day is out, I'll have called all my clients. All of them. (to Mike Pyle) So hey, congratulations Pyle of Shit-- you just bought a company that's losing half its business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah Timbo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Pyle blinks several times. Krogstad seethes. Before can fully bask in the glow of his triumph:

dialogues.speaker: ORIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Right there, officer. That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin, still in his pajamas and caked in hog shit, points CEDAR RAPIDS COPS in Tim's direction. Tactful pandemonium ensues. Dean, Ronald and Joan rush to Tim's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Lippe, what did you do? Aw jeez. This is no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the fucking charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the cops get to him, Tim hands Dean a crumpled pie of paper. 110. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop cuffs Tim and leads him out of the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim sits on a metal bench in a dank holding cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking-- thinking "this wiseacre's full of baloney." Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal: He's chatting with a massive black man, REGINALD,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm telling you Reginald, you're actually a perfect candidate for term life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD opens the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim Lip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pronounce it like Lippy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're outta here, Lippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim hands Reginald a business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. Call any time-- on the mobile or home phone, though. The office number's no good anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reginald gives Tim a warm hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Tim. You're all right. 111. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim walks out of the jail into the bright sunlight. Dean there waiting for him. They walk toward Dean's minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even say it, Deanzie-- no one butt rammed me or whatever in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Butt ram!" I love it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean gives Tim a hug. He then pulls a crumpled piece of p from his pocket-- it's the sheet Tim gave him earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want your get out of jail free card back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saw it, at first I was like, shit am I supposed to take money out of the account, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it was more fun watching the smug fuck sweat. I told him I'd rat his pathetic ass out if he didn't drop the charges against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a genuine smile) Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean tosses the paper into the trash. We now see what it On Holiday Inn stationary, in Tim's scrawl: www.paypal.co Username: OrinHelgesson. Password: PontoonMan123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean drives. Ronald rides shotgun. Tim and Joan are in ba The minivan cruises past downtown Cedar Rapids. Tim looks at the buildings. So tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald considers his Two Diamond plaque. 112. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as cool as I thought it'd be. I don't think this is even real wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lacking his usual energy) I'll show you some real wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald starts giggling. It turns into a laugh. The laugh becomes infectious. Before long, Tim, Joan, Ronald and De are all laughing their asses off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, Ronald and Joan accompany Tim, now cleaned up, to t airport. Tim sets down his old American Tourister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep subject. D'aar. Get it? (punches his arm) I told you you were a hero, Lippe. Insurance Man saves the day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tss. Ruined it more like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True sign of a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, pal, it's been real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, my cousin Bob-- guy made a truckload selling these little scented pine trees all the ragheads hang in their cabs? Fuckin' believe that? Anyhow, he's got a sweet cottage up on Lake of the Woods. Canada? I can use it whenever I want.
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we book it for June, before the mosquitoes go apeshit up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More time in a tightly enclosed space with Ziegler. Gee, sign me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it sounds awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, me too. The Ronimal could use a vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean picks Tim up in a bear hug, spins him around. Ronald gives Tim a more subdued hug. Then there's Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Keep in touch. E-mail, all that good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. You bet. You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're ever-- not that you would be-- ever in Oh-my-God, Nebraska...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom. I used to watch that. Would be cool some day to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts out his hand. She laughs and hugs him instead. Ti closes his eyes. She feels so good. Smells so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan's eyes are wide open. She swallows hard. She will no cry. It's OK. Keep telling yourself everything will be OK
Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks out the window, watching the city lights of Ced Rapids fade away. He catches his reflection in the window exhales. He smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim relaxes in his seat. He looks at his seat mate, a pleasant-looking WOMAN in her mid-30s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, did you do anything fun in Cedar Rapids...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERSCRIPT: One Day Later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim loads a plate with macaroni, meatloaf, peas and mashe potatoes. Millie selects fish, potatoes, rice and corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wordlessly walk from the buffet to a booth. They sit start eating in silence. After a bit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the walleye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decent. Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meatloaf's on the dry side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim tries to smile at Millie. He is surprised to see that eyes are filling with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without saying a word, Millie struggles to pry the small diamond engagement ring from her sausage-like finger. Finally, she gets it off and hands it to Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks of protesting. Instead, he takes the ring and p it in his pocket. Millie sniffles a bit, composes herself Tim opens his mouth to say something. Before he can think anything to say: 115. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade sits down with a ridiculously full plate of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, where were they hidin' the meatloaf...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim dumps birdseed in the feeder. Sunlight filters throug the tree branches. The snow is starting to melt.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You're just gonna attract red squirrels with that junk, Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim smiles at his old, gnarled neighbor, LESLIE, 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin' there, Leslie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach, I'm too old to give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take off their gloves to shake hands. Leslie won't l go of Tim's hand-- the way old men sometimes do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Krogstad told me he's switching our policy to some fella down in Milwaukee. Allstate. Says I won't notice a bit of difference in coverage or nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you probably won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. Anyhow, I told the cocksucker to go fuck himself. Says I'm going with Tim Lippe. A man I can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing you're doin'-- keepin' work in Brown Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie pats Tim on the shoulder. As he heads back inside: 116. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know when them red squirrels show up at your feeder. I'll borrow you my 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim chuckles. He goes back to his yard. He pauses. At his feeder: A robin. A sure sign of spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uplifting song fades in, along with:

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The chances we take in life are called risks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ON A LAKE: Tim is pulled behind a boat on waterskis. He falls face first, skipping across the lake.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We pay insurance companies premiums as a way of hedging our bets, in case those risks we take cause us or our property harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AT A BALL DIAMOND: Tim, playing in a summer softball league, slides headfirst into third base.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's the point of insurance-- so we can live and love life to the fullest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AT A STRIP MALL: A COUPLE walks past a discount shoe st and into TIM LIPPE INSURANCE. The camera follows them int the cramped, decidedly unimpressive office. Tim, seated a desk, looks directly at the camera and stiffly addresses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Tim Lippe Insurance, we can't guarantee that you'll live your life without devastating losses. But we can give you peace of mind-- knowing that if something awful or unfortunate does happen-- we'll have you covered. Tim Lippe Insurance. Insuring your Home and your Hopes. 117. Cedar Rapids, 6-12-09

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fanciful unicorn prances across the screen, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Tim, Dean and Ronald have been watching Tim's ad TV at a lakeside cabin. Tim looks proudly at his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I be honest here, Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was with the fuckin' unicorn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It represented hope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All's I'm saying is you might've wanted to hire an actor with some professional training...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus-- a retarded kid just sitting there yelling would've been better than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you're both a couple of a- holes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim whips an empty beer can at Dean. The three friends la living life in the moment. As it should be.
